page.title: 04CRANFIELD'S MAY DAY
page.content: { May Day} 1985 in Cranfield was surprisingly sunny (it's usually cold and wet). In the {Carnival of Floats there were ten floats and some Army Cadets. These floats were judged at Broad Green at 1.15pm by Mr and Mrs F.Lane.Then at about 1.30pm the floats started off, led by the Kempston Girls Brigade Band. They were followed by the{May Queen}float. The May Queen for 1985 was Lorraine Burgess (13),her senior attendants were Michelle Pyrah (13) and Marie Wooding (10),and her junior attendants were Anna Green (7) and Sharon Wallace (7). When the procession reached it's destination (Cranfield Airfield) the winning float and two runners up were announced. They were;3rd "There was an old woman who lived in a shoe" by the Methodist Church;2nd "The Land of Make Believe" by the Dancing School.
